website_summaries.verdict: Very low price point, especially for the Garmin brand name. Rugged protection case included.
pros: Unit makes fast connections with satellites
Includes 2.2-inch monochrome display screen that provides valuable information, but screen quality lags others
Well below average price point for accurate GPS standalone device
cons: Device will be too simplistic for some

customer_reviews.title: False advertising of unit
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself is fine, my problem with it is false advertising, the unit says it has pre-loaded maps, and also has an extra 8GB for extra maps. The reason I purchased it was to add more maps and have the SD card slot for additional maps. Unfortunately what is not made clear is that the pre-loaded maps take up 92% of the 8GB storage leaving only the SD card slot. This is the reason I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great  Space Age Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works fantastic for a NH Hiker, Hunter, Driver, Etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: We use it for geocaching and it works well to confirm latitude and longitude.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Howard

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking gps
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is standard, user interface is good, not great that's why 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Freyder

customer_reviews.title: Full of features in a tiny package.
customer_reviews.text: A much better evolution over the earlier models in this format. Bright colors and more readable menus. I ended up seeking a refund because the screen was just too small for what I wanted to do. To move around on the map, a little joystick is employed and it is either too insensitive or too sensitive, so movement is awkward. I later opted for the GPSMap 78s model, which has the added benefit of floating in water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little GPS unit
customer_reviews.text: Good little compact unit. Everything I expected except the preloaded topo maps. They were in there but not very detailed. I ended up buying the Garmin SD card with the more detailed topos. If you buy this GPS for hiking in rugged terràin, you will need the SDcard. Other than that, I liked it. It kept the satellites even when it was in my pocket in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: pointer not centered
customer_reviews.text: wish the pointer would always center in the middle of the screen always on the bottom never centered
customer_reviews.author: wincenty

customer_reviews.title: God why did I buy this. So sad
customer_reviews.text: Your cell phone is way more accurate and has many many more features.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: it's good
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller than I thought. I wish I had a detailed manual.
customer_reviews.author: kwonyongsung

customer_reviews.title: This seems like technology from 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: It's 2020. I have an iphone that can do everything this can do, and better, using the Gaia app. Which is free. Paying $300 for this is ridiculous. It's not light. It's incredibly slow. The controls are terrible. It doesn't even play Snake. Adding maps and setting up Garmin Basecamp is a huge pain. Don't waste time or money on this. It might be durable, and the only reason I can see bringing this along is in case your phone breaks or you lose power and your battery bank loses power. I regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: jfgtma

customer_reviews.title: Probably need to look at something better
customer_reviews.text: It has the great GOS accuracy you know and love about Garmin. GUI is pretty but overall does not seem to have any "dazzling" functionality beyond the e10 of 15 years ago. Does interface to computer better and battery life is longer and does have a lot of features. I purchased map data from Garmin and their software could not load it I to the etrex22. ultimately got a refund for the map after support got no where and am so close to returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Train

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Rhino. This works very well, is intuitive, and I can see the screen in the field. It has all the functions I need and has sufficiently long battery power that I am not always changing batteries. It fits in the front pocket of my shirt or jeans. Google any questions you have and there are usually YouTube tutorials. I am very happy with this. It quickly finds the satellites and narrows down to 2 to 3 meters on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: D. Seymour

customer_reviews.title: eTrex Arrived Defective!
customer_reviews.text: eTrex Arrived Defective! Packing and original Garmin box were excellent. Out of factory box the eTrex would only hold 5% of the Waypoints in memory that it should hold. I had six different calls to Garmin Tech who could NOT resolve the issue or even get a basic reset on the unit. I returned it with request for full refund. No Quality Control.
customer_reviews.author: SansReply

customer_reviews.title: Get lost they said
customer_reviews.text: You're definitely will not get lost you can load your custom PO wise that you have fear other garment devices on this with poi factory it's awesome
customer_reviews.author: C. Scully

customer_reviews.title: what an awful product for $$$200
customer_reviews.text: $200 for this toy like from 10 years ago? Wouldn’t the $200 apple watch w/ gps better? So many useless functions without making the gps itself good enough. Need additional $100 just for compass and altimeter. Bulky design, low pixel screen, slow CPU, no charging battery. I think I d just get an Android with my 200 bucks and it will for sure works better. I hope some other company can come up with decent portable gps and kick Garmin off the market forever.
customer_reviews.author: SONG XI

customer_reviews.title: Great for rockhounding!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for rockhounding! Took me right to the spots.
customer_reviews.author: Edvard McKie

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: I found free maps to download but not able to download for android.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, accurate, gets you back out of the woods hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't accurately record time or distance.
customer_reviews.text: Just returned my unit. Went on a four hour , 7 mile hike today which the unit calculated as 25.4 miles, over 1 hour and four minutes. It estimated my average speed at 23.4 miles per hour and my max speed at 15 mph. Which means neither time, distance nor basic math in the Garmin universe bear any relation to the real world. I'll just use an app on my cell phone- at least it'll get the time right.
customer_reviews.author: michel cox

product_meta.title: Garmin eTrex 22x, Rugged Handheld GPS Navigator
product_meta.description: Style:22x| Pattern Name:GPS NavigatorExplore with confidence with Terex 22x, a rugged GPS handheld with a 2.2” sunlight-readable color display. It comes preloaded with Topo Active mapping featuring routable roads and trails to explore when cycling and hiking. Add even more maps via the micros card slot and 8 GB of internal memory. With dual-satellite support (GPS and GLONASS), it tracks in more challenging environments than GPS alone.
feature_bullets: Explore confidently with the reliable handheld GPS
2.2” sunlight-readable color display with 240 x 320 display pixels for improved readability
Preloaded with Topo Active maps with routable roads and trails for cycling and hiking
Support for GPS and GLONASS satellite systems allows for tracking in more challenging environments than GPS alone
8 GB of internal memory for map downloads plus a micro SD card slot
Battery life: up to 25 hours in GPS mode with 2 AA batteries

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars98 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Road-Routable TopoActive Maps; GPS and GLONASS Satellite Service
